value.title: Create no-code predictive models with Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure Machine Learning to create and publish machine learning models without writing code.

topItems.title: Use automated machine learning in Azure Machine Learning
topItems.excerpt: Training a machine learning model is an iterative process that requires time and compute resources. Automated machine learning can help make it easier.

topItems.title: Create a Regression Model with Azure Machine Learning designer
topItems.excerpt: Regression is a supervised machine learning technique used to predict numeric values. Learn how to create regression models using Azure Machine Learning designer.

topItems.title: Create a classification model with Azure Machine Learning designer
topItems.excerpt: Classification is a supervised machine learning technique used to predict categories or classes. Learn how to create classification models using Azure Machine Learning designer.

topItems.title: Create a Clustering Model with Azure Machine Learning designer
topItems.excerpt: Clustering is an unsupervised machine learning technique used to group similar entities based on their features. Learn how to create clustering models using Azure Machine Learning designer.

value.title: Securely connect IoT devices to the cloud
value.excerpt: Follow this learning path to learn how to securely connect IoT devices with Azure IoT.

topItems.title: Learn how to manage IoT devices as an IT admin
topItems.excerpt: This module is an introduction to the Internet of Things for IT admins.

topItems.title: Automatically provision IoT devices securely and at scale with the Device Provisioning Service
topItems.excerpt: The focus of this module is on creating a Device Provisioning Service (DPS) to securely handle multiple remote devices. First, you create an IoT Hub, and add the DPS service. Next, an X.509 root certificate, and multiple leaf certificates, are created to handle security. Code for a simulated device is provided. You then link all the pieces together, and verify that your DPS resource works. After completing the module, you should have a good understanding of how to provision Azure IoT devices at scale.

topItems.title: Identify anomalies by routing data via IoT Hub to a built-in ML model in Azure Stream Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Learn about Azure IoT Hub message routing, and Stream Analytics anomaly detection. Start by creating an app that simulates issues with conveyor belt vibration. Then, use the Azure portal to route all the data for archiving in blob storage. Finish by routing the vibration data to anomaly detection, using a built-in ML model.

topItems.title: Remotely monitor and control devices with Azure IoT Hub
topItems.excerpt: Create an IoT Hub device app, and a back-end service app. As a scenario, we use the monitoring, and controlling, of the temperature and humidity of a cheese cave.

value.title: Threat Modeling Security Fundamentals
value.excerpt: This learning path takes you through the four main phases of threat modeling, explains the differences between each data-flow diagram element, walks you through the threat modeling framework, recommends different tools and gives you a step-by-step guide on creating proper data-flow diagrams.

topItems.title: Introduction to threat modeling
topItems.excerpt: Explore the four high-level steps of threat modeling.

topItems.title: Create a threat model using data-flow diagram elements
topItems.excerpt: Data-flow diagrams are graphical representations of your system and should specify each element, their interactions and context.

topItems.title: Provide context with the right depth layer
topItems.excerpt: Threat models can get complex if all parties involved cannot agree on a data-flow diagram depth layer that provides enough context to satisfy requirements

topItems.title: Approach your data-flow diagram with the right threat model focus
topItems.excerpt: Threat modeling is an effective technique to help you identify threats and ways to reduce or eliminate risk. We start by deciding to focus on either what needs to be protected or who it needs protection from.

value.title: Azure SQL fundamentals
value.excerpt: Learn how to deploy, secure, monitor and troubleshoot Azure SQL database.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure SQL
topItems.excerpt: This module introduces Azure SQL. Learn about various deployment options and service tiers and what to use for your organization.

topItems.title: Deploy and configure servers, instances, and databases for Azure SQL
topItems.excerpt: Deploy and configure servers, instances, and databases for Azure SQL

topItems.title: Secure your data with Azure SQL
topItems.excerpt: Secure your data with Azure SQL

topItems.title: Deliver consistent performance with Azure SQL
topItems.excerpt: Deliver consistent performance with Azure SQL

value.title: Building Open Source Software (OSS) Analytics Solutions with Azure HDInsight
value.excerpt: Building Open Source Software (OSS) Analytics Solutions with Azure HDInsight

topItems.title: Introduction to the Open source Analytics Offering
topItems.excerpt: Introduction to the Open source Analytics Offering

topItems.title: Choose the correct HDInsight Configuration to build open-source analytics solutions
topItems.excerpt: Choose the correct HDInsight Configuration to build open-source analytics solutions

topItems.title: Creating and configuring a HDInsight cluster
topItems.excerpt: Creating and configuring a HDInsight Cluster

topItems.title: Run Petabyte level OSS NoSQL databases with HDInsight HBase
topItems.excerpt: Run Petabyte level OSS NoSQL databases with HDInsight HBase

value.title: Foundations of data science
value.excerpt: Learn python programming and data science together with UC Berkeley's data 8: foundations of data science course

topItems.title: Learn the data science method
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the history and motivation behind data science

topItems.title: Introduction to Python using the datascience library
topItems.excerpt: Learn about Python expressions, functions, basic data types(numbers, strings), and comparisons

topItems.title: Create and manipulate tables using the datascience library
topItems.excerpt: Learn the basics of table manipulation in the datascience library

topItems.title: Design and plot graphs in Python
topItems.excerpt: Learn

value.title: AZ-400: Manage source control
value.excerpt: Use GitHub to build a modern source control strategy and prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Introduction to GitHub
topItems.excerpt: Learn to use key GitHub features, including issues, notifications, branches, commits, and pull requests.

topItems.title: Migrate your repository by using GitHub best practices
topItems.excerpt: Learn to move your existing project to GitHub from a legacy version control system.

topItems.title: Upload your project by using GitHub best practices
topItems.excerpt: Learn to upload your existing project to GitHub.

topItems.title: Manage repository changes by using pull requests on GitHub
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to manage changes to your repository source by using pull requests.

value.title: Develop IoT solutions with Azure IoT Central
value.excerpt: Follow this learning path for a broad and compelling introduction to the fundamentals of building IoT solutions with Azure IoT.

topItems.title: Create your first Azure IoT Central app
topItems.excerpt: This module builds an IoT Central app to monitor and command a refrigerated truck. The first unit creates the app, the second unit defines a device template for a refrigerated truck. Then, create a programming project, add code to simulate a truck, and communicate with your IoT Central app. The truck is monitored through a custom dashboard.

topItems.title: Set up rules and take action on telemetry data in Azure IoT Central
topItems.excerpt: This module builds an IoT Central app to monitor and command a refrigerated truck. We build the IoT Central app from a downloaded JSON file, defining all the device capabilities. Source code is also downloaded for the device app. The focus of this module is on creating rules and actions, to respond to certain telemetry input. Rules and actions enable greater automation of an IoT Central system.

topItems.title: Manage IoT Central applications with the REST API
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to manage an IoT Central application programmatically using the REST API

topItems.title: Set up continuous data export from Azure IoT Central to a Power BI app
topItems.excerpt: This module covers continuous data export from IoT Central. You use the scenario from your previously completed "Create your first Azure IoT Central app" Learn module, where you controlled a refrigerated truck. Here, in this module, you add continuous data export to both Azure Blob storage and an event hub. You then build a Power BI app to read and display the telemetry data on a mobile phone.

value.title: Optimize query performance in SQL Server
value.excerpt: Analyze individual query performance and determine where improvements can be made. Explore performance-related Dynamic Management Objects. Investigate how indexes and database design affect queries.

topItems.title: Describe SQL Server query plans
topItems.excerpt: Read and understand various forms of execution plans. Compare estimated vs actual plans. Learn how and why plans are generated.

topItems.title: Evaluate performance improvements
topItems.excerpt: Evaluate possible changes to indexes. Determine the impact of changes to queries and indexes. Explore relevant Dynamic Management Objects.

topItems.title: Explore performance-based design
topItems.excerpt: Evaluate possible changes to indexes. Determine the impact of changes to queries and indexes. Explore relevant Dynamic Management Objects.

value.title: Automate your workflow with GitHub Actions
value.excerpt: Learn how GitHub Actions enables you to automate your software development cycle and deploy applications to Azure.

topItems.title: Introduction to GitHub
topItems.excerpt: Learn to use key GitHub features, including issues, notifications, branches, commits, and pull requests.

topItems.title: Automate development tasks by using GitHub Actions
topItems.excerpt: Create a basic GitHub Action and use that action in a workflow.

topItems.title: Build continuous integration (CI) workflows by using GitHub Actions
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create workflows that enable you to use Continuous Integration (CI) for your projects.

topItems.title: Build and deploy applications to Azure by using GitHub Actions
topItems.excerpt: Create two deployment workflows using GitHub Actions and Microsoft Azure.

value.title: Azure Fundamentals part 2: Describe core Azure services
value.excerpt: This learning path provides you with an introduction to the basics of Azure's core services for compute, network, storage, and database.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure fundamentals
topItems.excerpt: This module introduces you to the basics of Azure.

topItems.title: Explore Azure database and analytics services
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the database services that are available on Microsoft Azure, such as Azure Cosmos DB, Azure SQL, Azure Database for MySQL, Azure Database for PostgreSQL, as well as big data and analytics.

topItems.title: Explore Azure compute services
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the different services that are available in Azure Compute.

topItems.title: Explore Azure Storage services
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the different storage options that are available in Azure Storage.

value.title: Implement Microsoft identity  Associate
value.excerpt: The Microsoft identity platform is an evolution of the Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) developer platform. It allows developers to build applications that sign in users, and access resources in both external applications such as Microsoft Office 365, the Azure portal, and thousands of other SaaS applications and internal resources, such as apps on your corporate network and intranet, along with any cloud apps developed by your own organization. Learn how to utilize Microsoft identity in your custom applications.

topItems.title: Getting Started with Microsoft Identity
topItems.excerpt: Learn the basics of Microsoft identity including the different types of tokens, account types, and supported topologies.

topItems.title: Application types in Microsoft identity
topItems.excerpt: Learn how developers can leverage Microsoft identity in different types of applications.

topItems.title: Permissions and Consent Framework
topItems.excerpt: Learn the basics of Microsoft identity including the different types of tokens, account types, and supported topologies.

topItems.title: Secure custom APIs with Microsoft Identity
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to secure a web API with Microsoft identity and how to call it from another application.

value.title: Identify guiding principles for responsible AI in government
value.excerpt: It's imperative to reflect on the implications of AI in Government. Discover guidelines to set up principles and a governance model in your organization.

topItems.title: Identify guiding principles for responsible AI
topItems.excerpt: Explore six principles to guide AI development and use - fairness, reliability and safety, privacy and security, inclusiveness, transparency, and accountability

topItems.title: Identify governing practices for responsible AI in government
topItems.excerpt: Learn guiding principles for governments, and how to choose and operationalize a governance system to responsibly and successfully use AI in the public sector.

topItems.title: Discuss practices for responsible AI at Microsoft
topItems.excerpt: Discover how to translate your organizations ethical principles into actionable guidance and tools for engineering teams and how AI can improve lives worldwide

value.title: Identify principles and practices for responsible AI
value.excerpt: It's imperative to reflect on the implications of AI in business. Discover Microsoft guidelines to set up principles and a governance model in your enterprise.

topItems.title: Identify guiding principles for responsible AI
topItems.excerpt: Explore six principles to guide AI development and use - fairness, reliability and safety, privacy and security, inclusiveness, transparency, and accountability

topItems.title: Identify governing practices for responsible AI
topItems.excerpt: Learn guiding principles for organizations, and how to choose and operationalize a governance system to responsibly and successfully use AI in the enterprise.

topItems.title: Discuss practices for responsible AI at Microsoft
topItems.excerpt: Discover how to translate your organizations ethical principles into actionable guidance and tools for engineering teams and how AI can improve lives worldwide

value.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices
value.excerpt: The reliability of your systems, services and products has a direct impact on your success. Learn the modern operations principles and practices (and the Azure features that support them) that will help you achieve the level of reliability you need.

topItems.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices: An introduction
topItems.excerpt: Discover a map for navigating reliability challenges and sustainably achieving the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.

topItems.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices: Monitoring
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use monitoring to help you sustainably achieve the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.

topItems.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices: Incident response
topItems.excerpt: Learn the incident response fundamentals necessary to help you sustainably achieve the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.

topItems.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices: Learning from failure
topItems.excerpt: Learn about post-incident reviews, a practice necessary to help you sustainably achieve the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.

value.title: Quantum computing foundations
value.excerpt: Intrigued by quantum computing but don't know where to start? This learning path helps prepare you for this exciting next generation of computing.

topItems.title: Create your first Q# program by using the Quantum Development Kit
topItems.excerpt: Get started with Q# programming by building a quantum random number generator.

topItems.title: Explore the key concepts of quantum computing by using Q#
topItems.excerpt: Learn the fundamental concepts of quantum computing by using tools in Q# and the Quantum Development Kit.

topItems.title: Solve graph coloring problems by using Grover's search
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Grover's algorithm can help you solve search problems such as graph coloring problems.

topItems.title: Solve optimization problems by using quantum-inspired optimization
topItems.excerpt: Learn how quantum-inspired algorithms mimic quantum physics to solve difficult optimization problems.

value.title: Automate your deployments with Azure DevOps
value.excerpt: Learn how to combine automation techniques such as infrastructure as code with automated pipelines to provision and configure the infrastructure you need to run your applications and services.

topItems.title: Provision infrastructure in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Learn how infrastructure as code enables you to describe and automatically provision the infrastructure that you need for your application.

topItems.title: Configure infrastructure in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Run configuration management tools in Azure Pipelines to help keep your infrastructure configured as you need.

topItems.title: Provision databases in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Provision databases in Azure Pipelines

value.title: Azure Fundamentals part 3: Describe core solutions and management tools on Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to choose the best services from Azure to build and manage cloud solutions.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure fundamentals
topItems.excerpt: This module introduces you to the basics of Azure.

topItems.title: Choose the best AI service for your needs
topItems.excerpt: Examine Azure's AI services, and choose the right one for your company.

topItems.title: Choose the best tools to help organizations build better solutions
topItems.excerpt: Learn about Microsoft tools and services that help developers and operations engineers build modern solutions for the cloud and on-premises.

topItems.title: Choose the best monitoring service for visibility, insight, and mitigation of service outages
topItems.excerpt: Discover solutions that help IT organizations with insights into the health and performance of their applications running in the cloud.

value.title: Build the intelligent edge with Azure IoT Edge
value.excerpt: Follow this learning path for a broad and compelling introduction to the fundamentals of building IoT solutions with Azure IoT.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Edge
topItems.excerpt: University of Oxford

topItems.title: Deploy a pre-built module to the Edge device
topItems.excerpt: University of Oxford

topItems.title: Set up an IoT Edge Gateway
topItems.excerpt: This module is theoretical and will walk you through how an IoT Edge device can be used as a gateway.

value.title: Cloud computing basics for developers
value.excerpt: The first learning path in a course on cloud computing for developers from Carnegie Mellon University. Learn about the basics of the cloud, including the history, building blocks, and types. This learning path prepares developers for real-world cloud practice on Azure.

topItems.title: Foundations of cloud computing for developers
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Discover what the cloud is, the history of cloud computing, what types of clouds are available, and how you might use the cloud.

topItems.title: Economics of cloud computing
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn how developers pay to use the cloud and how cloud providers are able to charge for their services. Get an overview of how the cloud is kept secure.

topItems.title: Datacenter trends in cloud computing
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Datacenters are what power the cloud. Learn what they are, how they work, and challenges in managing them.

topItems.title: Datacenter components
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Take a deep dive into datacenters to discover how they are laid out and how computing resources are provisioned and metered.

value.title: Migrate virtual machines and apps using Azure Migrate
value.excerpt: The Virtual machine and app migration using Azure Migrate learning path gives you a step-by-step process to help you understand, set up, assess, and migrate virtual and physical servers, databases, applications, and virtual desktops from on-premises to the Azure infrastructure. Azure Migrate now includes fully integrated and optimized migration-specific tools previously available only in Azure Site Recovery.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure Migrate for server migration
topItems.excerpt: Discover how Azure Migrate helps you realize the benefits of moving your on-premises VMware or Hyper-V server workloads to Azure infrastructure as a service (IaaS). Learn the process for migrating your workload agent-less, all within the hub.

topItems.title: Set up Azure Migrate for server migration
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to check your prerequisite configurations in Azure and in your VMware vSphere environment and then perform the initial steps in Azure Migrate to choose your assessment and migration tools.

topItems.title: Discover and Assess your on-premises servers with Azure Migrate
topItems.excerpt: Explore the Azure Migrate tools for discovering and assessing your virtual machine servers. Learn how to install and configure a virtual machine appliance in your virtualization host infrastructure.

topItems.title: Replicate and migrate virtual machine servers with Azure Migrate
topItems.excerpt: Learn the process for replicating, testing, and finally migrating your virtual machines into production.

value.title: Migrating open-source workloads to Azure
value.excerpt: Migrate open-source workloads

topItems.title: Introduction to open-source database migration on Azure
topItems.excerpt: "Introduction to open-source database migration on Azure"

topItems.title: Migrate on-premises MySQL databases to Azure Database for MySQL
topItems.excerpt: "Migrate on-premises MySQL to Azure Database for MySQL"

topItems.title: Migrate on-premises PostgreSQL databases to Azure Database for PostgreSQL
topItems.excerpt: Migrate on-premises PostgreSQL to Azure Database for PostgreSQL

topItems.title: Protecting, monitoring and tuning a migrated database
topItems.excerpt: Protecting, monitoring, and tuning a migrated database

value.title: Virtualization - Sharing cloud resources
value.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Dive deeper into how the cloud works by understanding virtualization. How are computing power, memory, input and output, networking, and storage virtualized?

topItems.title: Share cloud resources
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Get an introduction to virtualization, one of the many technologies that power the cloud. Learn what virtualization is, its benefits, and how cloud resources are shared.

topItems.title: Understand virtualization
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Take a deep dive into virtualization by understanding its formal definition as well as the different types of virtual machines.

topItems.title: Virtualize computing power
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn about how computing power is virtualized using virtual CPUs. Covers different types of CPU virtualization.

topItems.title: Virtualize memory
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn how memory is virtualized to support cloud resources. Covers different types of memory mapping and related issues.

value.title: Working with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365 and Azure IoT
value.excerpt: This learning path introduces you to connected Field Service and Azure IoT. Included in this learning path is identifying exceptions, register and manage devices, remotely monitor and service equipment, and using IoT central with connected Field Service.

topItems.title: Get started with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365 and Azure IoT
topItems.excerpt: This module will focus on the initial deployment of the Connected Field Service add-on for Dynamics 365 for Field Service.  The module will walk you through the installation and an understanding of the components installed as part of the out of the box template application.

topItems.title: Remotely monitor and service equipment with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365 and Azure IoT
topItems.excerpt: Configure IoT devices to remotely monitor customer equipment.

topItems.title: Register and manage devices with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365 and Azure IoT
topItems.excerpt: Register and Manage Customer Devices with Connected Field Service.

topItems.title: Using IoT Central with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365
topItems.excerpt: This module will focus on using IoT Central with Connected Field Service add-on for Dynamics 365 for Field Service.  The module will walk you through building an IoT Central application and escalating the alerts into Dynamics 365.

value.title: Azure Portal How To Series
value.excerpt: Welcome to our weekly series that highlights specific aspects of the Azure portal so you can be more efficient and productive while deploying your cloud workloads from the portal.

topItems.title: How to add and secure a custom domain on your App Service web app | Azure Portal Series
topItems.excerpt: In this video, learn about Azure best practices on how to add a custom domain to your web app and how to secure your custom domain with an App Service Managed Certificate.   Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com   Keep connected on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AzurePortal

topItems.title: How to create and manage an App Service Domain | Azure Portal Series
topItems.excerpt: In this video, learn about the advantages of using an App Service Domain and how to create an App Service Domain using the Azure portal.   Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com  Keep connected on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AzurePortal  And make sure to keep an eye on
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/b1kDT8-6a3g" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: Improvements to the Linux Virtual Machine experience | Azure Portal Series
topItems.excerpt: In this episode of the #Azure Portal "How To" Series, learn more about the improvements to the Linux Virtual Machine (VM) experience such as automatic SSH key generation, a new and improved landing page, and a new seamless connect experience.   Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com

topItems.title: How to use blob versioning | Azure Portal Series
topItems.excerpt: In this video of the #Azure Portal "How To" series, learn how to automatically maintain previous versions of your blob and restore an earlier version of your blob if it is erroneously modified or deleted.   Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com  Keep connected on Twitter:

value.title: Azure Fundamentals part 5: Describe identity, governance, privacy, and compliance features
value.excerpt: Learn how Azure can help you secure access to cloud resources, what it means to build a cloud governance strategy, and how Azure adheres to common regulatory and compliance standards.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure fundamentals
topItems.excerpt: This module introduces you to the basics of Azure.

topItems.title: Secure access to your applications by using Azure identity services
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure Active Directory, single sign-on (SSO), multifactor authentication, and Conditional Access can help you manage and secure identities on Azure.

topItems.title: Build a cloud governance strategy on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to access policies, resource locks, and tags, as well as how Azure services such as Azure Policy and Azure Blueprints can help you build a comprehensive cloud governance strategy.

topItems.title: Examine privacy, compliance, and data protection standards on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn about Microsoft's commitment to privacy, how Azure adheres to common regulatory and compliance standards, and additional considerations government agencies need to make.

value.title: Create an enterprise-scale architecture in Azure
value.excerpt: Explore how to create Azure landing zone architecture at enterprise scale.

topItems.title: Introduction to enterprise-scale landing zones in the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure
topItems.excerpt: The Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure provides many landing zone options. In this module, we'll focus on enterprise-scale landing zones.

topItems.title: Enterprise-scale architecture organizational design principles
topItems.excerpt: Enterprise-scale architecture organizational design principles

topItems.title: Enterprise-scale architecture networking design principles
topItems.excerpt: Enterprise-scale architecture networking design principles

topItems.title: Enterprise-scale architecture operational design principles
topItems.excerpt: Enterprise-scale architecture operational design principles

value.title: Capture feedback and monitoring data to continuously improve your software
value.excerpt: Learn how to configure release pipelines that continuously build, test, and deploy your applications.

topItems.title: Recommend and design system feedback mechanisms
topItems.excerpt: Learn how surveys and application analytics create a feedback loop that helps you understand the voice of the customer.

topItems.title: Route system feedback to development teams
topItems.excerpt: Learn how continuous monitoring and dashboards give you insight into how customers use your software and where patterns of failure occur.

topItems.title: Manage site reliability
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to manage site reliability.

value.title: Deploy and configure Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machine
value.excerpt: In this learning path, youll learn how to deploy and configure Azure IaaS Virtual Machine workloads. After completing the learning path, youll know how to plan, deploy, and upgrade Windows Server Azure Virtual Machines.

topItems.title: Plan and deploy Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machines
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to describe Azure compute and storage in relation to Azure VMs, and deploy Azure VMs by using the Azure portal, Azure CLI, or templates.

topItems.title: Customize Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machine images
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to create new VMs from generalized images and use Azure Image Builder templates to create and manage images in Azure.

topItems.title: Automate the configuration of Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machines
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to deploy Desired State Configuration (DSC) extensions, implement those extensions to remediate noncompliant servers, and use custom script extension.

topItems.title: Upgrade and migrate Windows Server IaaS virtual machines
topItems.excerpt: Learn to migrate a workload running in Windows Server to an infrastructure as a service (IaaS) virtual machine (VM) and to Windows Server 2019 by using Windows Server migration tools or the Storage Migration Service.
